title: Roberto López Ufarte
text:
Roberto López Ufarte (born 19 April 1958) is a Spanish former <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>.
Nicknamed "The little devil", most of his 14-year career was spent at <a href="Real%20Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a> where he played for 12 seasons, winning four major titles including two <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> championships. He also represented in the competition <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a> and <a href="Real%20Betis">Betis</a>, amassing totals of 418 matches and 112 goals.
López Ufarte appeared for <a href="Spain%20national%20football%20team">Spain</a> at the <a href="1982%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1982 World Cup</a>.
Club career.
López Ufarte was born in <a href="Fes">Fes</a>, <a href="Morocco">Morocco</a>. His parents, from <a href="Andalusia">Andalusia</a> and <a href="Catalonia">Catalonia</a>, moved abroad in search of work, and returned to <a href="Irun">Irun</a> (<a href="Basque%20Country%20%28autonomous%20community%29">Basque Country</a>) when their son was eight. After making his early footballing efforts at neighbouring <a href="Real%20Uni%C3%B3n">Real Unión</a> he signed for <a href="Real%20Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a>, making his <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> debut in the <a href="1975%E2%80%9376%20La%20Liga">1975–76 season</a>, playing his first game in the competition on 30 November 1975 in a 0–2 <a href="Local%20derby">derby</a> away loss against <a href="Athletic%20Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a> aged only 17. From then on he became an essential first-team member, scoring 16 goals in 63 matches in the side's back-to-back league titles.
López Ufarte left the "Txuriurdin" in 1987, after another solid season: 33 games and ten goals in <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20La%20Liga">the league</a>, and <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20Copa%20del%20Rey">the conquest</a> of the <a href="Copa%20del%20Rey">Copa del Rey</a>. He scored 129 goals in 474 official appearances during his spell.
After one season with <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a> (<a href="1987%E2%80%9388%20La%20Liga">third place</a>), López Ufarte closed his career at <a href="Real%20Betis">Real Betis</a> at the age of 31, after struggling with <a href="knee">knee</a> injuries and seeing his team <a href="1988%E2%80%9389%20La%20Liga">relegate</a> to the <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">second division</a>. He then acted as assistant manager to several coaches at his first professional club, following which he returned to Real Unión as <a href="director%20of%20football">director of football</a>.
International career.
López Ufarte won 15 caps for the <a href="Spain%20national%20football%20team">Spain national team</a>, in five years. His debut came on 21 September 1977, scoring in 2–1 <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly</a> win in <a href="Switzerland%20national%20football%20team">Switzerland</a>.
López Ufarte appeared for the nation at the <a href="1982%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1982 FIFA World Cup</a> which was held on home ground, playing his last match in a 1–2 second group stage loss against <a href="Germany%20national%20football%20team">West Germany</a>.
Honours.
Real Sociedad
